alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued May 07 at 11:25PM EDT until May 09 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...water may cover roads on St. Georges Island, be in yards, and approach structures. To the east, inundation is possible at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. Shoreline inundation up to one foot above ground is possible elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to three feet above normal are possible. High tide at Point Lookout Sunday night will be at 8:09 PM and high tide Monday morning will be at 8:16 AM. High tide at Piney Point Sunday night is at 9:02 PM and high tide Monday morning will be at 9:03 AM. High tide at Coltons Point Sunday night will be at 9:38 PM and high tide Monday morning will be at 9:39 PM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
